titles.title: A resolution to direct the Senate Legal Counsel to represent, and to authorize the testimony of, and production of documents by, Senate employees in the case of United States v. Carrothers.

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 6/16/1987--Introduced. Directs the Senate Legal Counsel to represent Jay A. Woodall, Senate Postmaster, and any other current or former Senate employee who may be asked to testify or produce documents in the case of United States v. Carrothers. Authorizes such employees to produce documents and to testify in such case, except concerning matters which are privileged.
